events.originalText: The Israel Defense Forces bombed the home of Salah Shehade, the leader of the military arm of the Palestinian organization Hamas, killing him, his family and neighboring civilians.
events.subtitle: Israel Defense Forces
events.headline: IDF Bombs Home of Hamas Leader Salah Shehade, Killing Him and Civilians

events.originalText: Written and illustrated by Eiichiro Oda, One Piece, the best-selling manga series in history, debuted in Weekly Shōnen Jump.
events.subtitle: Eiichiro Oda
events.headline: One Piece Manga Series Debuts in Weekly Shōnen Jump

events.originalText: American serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer was arrested in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, after police discovered human remains in his apartment.
events.subtitle: Serial killer
events.headline: Serial Killer Jeffrey Dahmer Arrested in Milwaukee

events.originalText: Stanley Forman took the Pulitzer Prize–winning photo Fire Escape Collapse, which spurred action to improve the safety of fire escapes across the United States.
events.subtitle: Stanley Forman
events.headline: Pulitzer Prize-Winning Photo Spurs Fire Escape Safety Improvements

events.originalText: The United Kingdom granted self-government to Sarawak.
events.subtitle: Sarawak
events.headline: UK Grants Self-Government to Sarawak

events.originalText: A limited state of martial law was declared in Russell County, Alabama, due to organized crime.
events.subtitle: Declaration of martial law in Russell County, Alabama
events.headline: Martial Law Declared in Russell County, Alabama

events.originalText: World War II: In opposition to the London-based government-in-exile, the Soviet-backed Polish Committee of National Liberation was proclaimed to govern territory recaptured from Nazi Germany.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet-Backed Polish Committee of National Liberation Proclaimed

events.originalText: Jules-Albert de Dion (pictured) finished first in the world's first motor race, but did not win as his steam-powered car was against the rules.
events.subtitle: Jules-Albert de Dion
events.headline: Jules-Albert de Dion Finishes First in World's First Motor Race

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate forces unsuccessfully attacked Union troops at the Battle of Atlanta.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Forces Fail to Take Atlanta

events.originalText: Gia Long (pictured) conquered Hanoi and unified modern-day Vietnam, which had experienced centuries of feudal warfare.
events.subtitle: Gia Long
events.headline: Gia Long Conquers Hanoi, Unifies Vietnam

events.originalText: Williamite forces defeated the Jacobites at the Battle of Aughrim, the decisive battle of the Williamite War in Ireland.
events.subtitle: Williamite
events.headline: Williamite Forces Triumph at Battle of Aughrim in Ireland

events.originalText: First War of Scottish Independence: English forces led by Edward I defeated William Wallace's Scottish troops at the Battle of Falkirk.
events.subtitle: First War of Scottish Independence
events.headline: Edward I Defeats William Wallace at Battle of Falkirk

events.originalText: A crusader army captured Béziers, France, and massacred the city's inhabitants in the first major military action of the Albigensian Crusade.
events.subtitle: Béziers
events.headline: Crusader Army Captures Béziers, France, in Albigensian Crusade

events.originalText: Arab–Byzantine wars: The forces of the Abbasid Caliphate defeated Byzantine troops led by Emperor Theophilos at the Battle of Anzen, near present-day Dazman, Turkey.
events.subtitle: Arab–Byzantine wars
events.headline: Abbasid Caliphate Defeats Byzantine Troops at Battle of Anzen
